name: Alfriston Clergy House to Berwick Church, Alfriston

ai.summary: A scenic 14.8 km walk from Alfriston Clergy House to Berwick Church in Alfriston, traversing Sussex countryside via rural lanes, chalk paths and farmland. The route offers open views and a moderate challenge suitable for walkers with some experience and solid footwear.
ai.terrain_summary: Terrain combines quiet country lanes, field edges and chalk tracks with occasional stiles and gentle ascents. Expect uneven surfaces, possible mud after rain, and sections of long grass in summer. The route is well signposted along rights of way, but a map or GPS helps if hedgerows obscure the way.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and daylight hours before setting out. Wear sturdy boots and bring waterproofs and extra layers. Carry a map or GPS, a charged phone, and a small first aid kit. Share your planned route with someone and be mindful of farm traffic; respect gates and livestock. Keep dogs under control and watch for muddy fields and slip hazards along tracks. Carry a headlamp if finishing after dark.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map and compass or GPS device
Emergency whistle and basic first aid kit
Headlamp or flashlight for late finishes
Mobile phone with offline maps; power bank
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn (roughly March to October), with ideal conditions in late spring and early autumn.

seo.title: Alfriston Clergy House to Berwick Church, Alfriston – 14.8 km Moderate Hike
